Thimo Eichstï¿½dt wrote:
> Hello,
>
> I want to restrict the number of fetched documents per webserver. I
> am using the QuotaEnforcer prefetch procesor.
> But I am unsure which directive should be configured,
> server-max-fetch-successes or host-max-fetch-successes ? Can anyone
> explain me the difference between them ?

One makes counts on a 'CrawlHost' 
[http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/datamodel/CrawlHost.html] 
basis.  The other on a 'CrawlServer' 
[http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/datamodel/CrawlServer.html]  
basis.  Coarsely, CrawlHost wraps a 'hostname' whereas CrawlServer is a 
particular service on a CrawlHost.  Examples of CrawlServices on a 
CrawlHost would be http on port 80, secure http (https) on port 443, etc.

If you want to count both http and https accesses against the same 
server quota, use host-max-fetch-successes.  If you want to count them 
distinctly, use server-max-fetch-successes.

Hope this helps,
St.Ack
>
> thanks
>    Thimo
